examples.scenario: Statistical claim needs data source verification

tool_sequence.reasoning: Identify specific factual claims that can be verified
Verify factual accuracy using authoritative sources
Find related content and historical context

reasoning_steps: Extract specific claims or statements to verify
Determine verification criteria and evidence standards
Search for authoritative sources using multiple methods
Cross-reference findings across independent sources
Evaluate source credibility and potential bias
Assess confidence level based on evidence quality
Document verification process for transparency
examples.expected_outcome: Nuanced content analysis addressing multiple perspectives, 65% confidence with 3 caveats noted

anti_patterns.description: Using tools in random order without logical progression
anti_patterns.why_bad: Later tools cannot benefit from earlier analysis, reducing effectiveness

anti_patterns.description: Ignoring relevant context and focusing only on isolated claims
anti_patterns.why_bad: Misses important nuance and can lead to misleading conclusions

anti_patterns.description: Accepting first source found without cross-checking
anti_patterns.why_bad: Leads to propagation of misinformation and low-quality analysis

examples.scenario: Political claim requires multi-source verification

tool_sequence.reasoning: Identify specific factual claims that can be verified
Verify factual accuracy using authoritative sources
Find related content and historical context
Present the strongest possible version of the argument
Preserve findings for future reference and learning

reasoning_steps: Extract specific claims or statements to verify
Determine verification criteria and evidence standards
Search for authoritative sources using multiple methods
Cross-reference findings across independent sources
Evaluate source credibility and potential bias
Assess confidence level based on evidence quality
Document verification process for transparency
Consider alternative interpretations and edge cases
Evaluate potential biases in sources and methodology
Assess broader implications and downstream effects
Plan for uncertainty and incomplete information
examples.expected_outcome: Comprehensive content analysis with 75% confidence, 6 sources verified, 1 limitations identified

anti_patterns.description: Accepting first source found without cross-checking
anti_patterns.why_bad: Leads to propagation of misinformation and low-quality analysis

anti_patterns.description: Claiming high confidence without sufficient evidence
anti_patterns.why_bad: Misleads users about the reliability of analysis

anti_patterns.description: Using every available tool regardless of relevance
anti_patterns.why_bad: Wastes resources and introduces noise into analysis

reasoning_steps: Extract specific claims or statements to verify
Determine verification criteria and evidence standards
Search for authoritative sources using multiple methods
Cross-reference findings across independent sources
Evaluate source credibility and potential bias
Assess confidence level based on evidence quality
Document verification process for transparency
Consider alternative interpretations and edge cases
Evaluate potential biases in sources and methodology
Assess broader implications and downstream effects
Plan for uncertainty and incomplete information
